text: R4.7. Blocks Read for a Flat Index Consider a file system with 2048-byte blocks that uses a flat index. In a particular file, we want to read the byte with offset 40012. Remember that the very first byte of a file is offset 0. How many blocks will be read from disk? Assume the index and relevant file metadata has already been read and is being cached. integer block(s) @ Save & Grade Single attempt Additional attempts available with new variants @
